Package org.neo4j.bolt.txtracking

Class TransactionIdTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.bolt.txtracking.TransactionIdTracker
  • public class TransactionIdTracker
extends Object
    Facility to allow a user to run a query on different members of the cluster and ensure that a member is at least as up to date as the state it read or wrote elsewhere.

    • Method Detail

      • newestTransactionId

        public long newestTransactionId​(NamedDatabaseId namedDatabaseId)
        Find the id of the Newest Encountered Transaction (NET) that could have been seen on this server for the specified database. We expect the returned id to be sent back the client and ultimately supplied to awaitUpToDate(NamedDatabaseId, long, Duration) on this server, or on a different server in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        namedDatabaseId - id of the database to find the NET for.
        Returns:
        id of the Newest Encountered Transaction (NET).

      • awaitUpToDate

        public void awaitUpToDate​(NamedDatabaseId namedDatabaseId,
                          long oldestAcceptableTxId,
                          Duration timeout)
        Wait for a specific transaction (the Oldest Acceptable Transaction - OAT) to have been applied before continuing. This method is useful in a clustered deployment, where different members of the cluster are expected to apply transactions at slightly different times.

        We assume the OAT will always have been applied on one member of the cluster, therefore it is sensible to wait for it to be applied on this member.

        The effect is either:

        1. If the transaction in question has already been applied, return immediately. This is the most common case because we expect the interval between dependent requests from the client to be longer than the replication lag between cluster members.
        2. The transaction has not yet been applied, block until the background replication process has applied it, or timeout.
        Parameters:
        namedDatabaseId - id of the database to find the transaction id.
        oldestAcceptableTxId - id of the Oldest Acceptable Transaction (OAT) that must have been applied before continuing work.
        timeout - maximum duration to wait for OAT to be applied
